protocol.text: Arabidopsis seedlings were grown in sterile liquid culture (Scheible et al., 2004) either for nine days in N-replete conditions (FN, 4 mM KNO3), or first during 7 days in FN and then for 2 days in N-deprivation conditions (no N added; noN).

Seedlings were pre-grown in 24 h light (150-180 µE, 20°C) on sterile 0.5% (w/v) agar plates (Falcon IntegridTM 100 mm square) containing 27 ml FN medium, and after 7 days seedlings were transferred individually to 24-well culture plates (Greiner Bio-one Cellstar #662160) containing 1 ml medium per well

All procedures including (i) quality control of RNA, (ii) biotin labeling of the cRNA target, (iii) hybridization, washing, staining, and scanning procedures, and (iv) processing of Affymetrix raw data (CEL files) were performed as outlined previously (Scheible et al., 2004).
The data were analyzed with Robin and RMA-normalized
Total RNA was prepared using Quiagen RNeasy plant mini kit
